I've been using JUnit for a few years now, and one thing that's always
both=
ered me is the "setUp" method.

I always do my initialization in my constru=
ctor (if I'm not just doing
it at the field definition) as constructors all=
ow me to initialize
final fields. The semantics of using a constructor also=
 seem far more
obvious to me as everyone reading my code knows Java, while =
not
everyone is a JUnit guru.

The additional complexity of having the (as =
far as I can tell)
redundant setUp method seems counterproductive, so why d=
oes setUp exist?
